intro: Banisteria elegans var. guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple berries that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and white or pale pink. The berries are edible when ripe but are often consumed by birds and other wildlife.
